abstract: Lawmakers in 10 states seeking to pass bills for so-called campus carry laws, which would legalize carrying firearms at colleges, are arguing that female students should be armed to help counter campus sexual assault; opponents claim that pro-gun lawmakers are exploiting issue that has come into national spotlight for their own agenda, and say plan is not likely to protect women and would increase gun-related accidents.
lead_paragraph: As lawmakers in 10 states push for so-called campus carry laws, an argument is taking shape: Arming female students will help reduce sexual assault.

headline.main: A Bid for Guns on Campuses to Deter Rape
headline.print_headline: A Bid for Guns on Campuses to Deter Rape

snippet: As lawmakers in 10 states push for so-called campus carry laws, an argument is taking shape: Arming female students will help reduce sexual assault.
